newsitem.title: SPAIN: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.

text.p: Spanish government bonds ended lower on Friday after a dull session as dealers positioned themselves for the Treasury's bond auctions next week.

For the first time, Spain's Treasury will offer strippable debt on Tuesday and Wednesday. Dealers noted a lot of interest in the new issues because domestic legal entities do not have to pay 25-percent withholding taxes.
"New issues will be cheaper and so, it's likely that investors will sell futures to cover their auction purchases," said a Madrid-based dealer.
But longer-term, the Spanish market is expected to remain positive, dealers said.
The 10-year spread over Bunds fell to around 67 basis points from 69 at the open and 65 at Thursday's close.

Money market dealers said short-term interest rates corrected slightly as expectations of an immediate official rate cut faded. Rate cut hopes faded after recent data showed a strong pick-up in the economy.
